intro: Fagara megalismontana, commonly known as the giant mountain fagara, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the humid montane forests of Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its large, glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments at higher elevations. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
